intro: Platanthera stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stalked twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Native to eastern North America, it thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in association with other orchids. The plant has a short underground stem and produces a single spike of flowers, typically in late summer. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
